intro: Vicia bacla, commonly known as the common vetch, is a leguminous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow pea-like flowers. Its pods contain several seeds, which are often used as a food source for livestock. Vicia bacla is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides.
